transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Alright team, first progress check on Project Phoenix. Let's go around and share updates. Alex, want to start with infrastructure?

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: Good news - the Kubernetes cluster is up and running in our staging environment. I've got three nodes provisioned with auto-scaling configured. CI/CD is mostly done - GitHub Actions workflows are working for build and test. Still working on the ArgoCD integration for deployments, should be done by tomorrow.

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: One thing - I need Marcus to finalize the service list so I can set up the deployment manifests properly. Right now I'm working with placeholder services.

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: Yeah, about that. I finished the service boundaries document. We're going with five services: user-service, billing-service, portal-api, notification-service, and analytics-service. I'll share the doc right after this call. I've also started on the user-service - basic CRUD operations and authentication are working locally.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Perfect. Jordan, how's the frontend coming along?

transcripts.speaker: Jordan Kim
transcripts.text: Component library is scaffolded. I met with the design team on Tuesday and we've defined our theme - colors, typography, spacing tokens. I've implemented about 15 base components so far - buttons, inputs, cards, modals. The login and dashboard pages are in progress. One issue though - I'm waiting on Marcus for the API contracts so I can wire up the real data.

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: Fair point. I'll have the OpenAPI specs for user-service and portal-api ready by end of day Monday. That should unblock you. We should also discuss the authentication flow - I'm implementing OAuth 2.0 with JWT tokens.

transcripts.speaker: Jordan Kim
transcripts.text: That works. I'll build the auth context to handle the JWT flow. Just make sure the token includes the user's role so I can handle permissions on the frontend. Oh, and I found a bug in our date handling - we need to standardize on UTC everywhere.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Good catch Jordan. Let's document that as a team standard. Marcus, add it to the architecture decision records. Speaking of documentation, I've set up the Linear project. All our epics are in there - Infrastructure, User Management, Billing, Portal Core, and Launch Prep. Please log your tasks there.

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: Will do. One heads up - I talked to the security team about our Datadog setup. They want us to use their enterprise account instead of spinning up our own. That actually saves us money but I need to coordinate with them on access. Meeting with them tomorrow.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Perfect, that's a good call. Alright, action items for next week. Marcus - OpenAPI specs by Monday, continue user-service development. Jordan - complete auth flow once you have the specs, keep building components. Alex - finish ArgoCD, coordinate with security on Datadog. I'll be working on the project roadmap and stakeholder updates. Same time next Thursday?

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: Works for me. Quick note - I might need Jordan's help with some frontend validation logic. Can we pair for an hour next week?

transcripts.speaker: Jordan Kim
transcripts.text: Absolutely. Tuesday afternoon works for me. Let's sync on Slack to confirm the time.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Great collaboration. We're on track for week 1. Keep up the momentum team!
